website_summaries.verdict: Complete with wireless access, remote printing in the cloud, an interactive touch screen, and several paper trays, the Epson WorkForce WF-3540 is well-prepared to handle large workloads for home offices, corporate teams, and everything in between.
pros: The Epson WorkForce WF-3540 workhorse multifunction is built for performance with cloud printing capabilities, extra-large-capacity ink cartridges, dual 250-sheet paper trays, an intuitive touch-screen display, and an external USB port for standalone copying and scanning
cons: The 3.5-inch touch-screen display works well with gesture navigation, but its fixed angle inhibits its usability in higher positions

customer_reviews.title: Ink nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in 2013, after years of tolerating constant little issues that it gives you I give up. Spent so much money on ink that dries out soooo quickly if you don't use it, and once one is gone every single function stops working until you replace it yet again after, in my case, one use a few months prior (talking about printing 1 page and cleaning a nozzle twice). This poc is worthless and I'm throwing it away with full xl black ink, and the other 2 basically new cartridges, because it stopped seeing my red one....I've had enough
customer_reviews.author: Alona

customer_reviews.title: A constant source of frustration
customer_reviews.text: We got two people at home who write software for a living and it would seem that it should be easy for us to work with this printer. Unfortunately, something or the other is always not working. The driver installation is incredibly stupid. I have the printer on and it prints the network status as Pass, but a new Windows laptop on the same network cannot connect it (how hard is it to let people enter the printer's ip address and port on the driver?) I end up emailing the document to the printer. I wonder what kind of usability studies they do to see if people can use their product easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Run away from this old version, discontinued machine.  Buy something newer.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of outdated, unsupported printing garbage. No software available for Mac users. This is an old version machine (2012) that the Espon rep said is not supported for Mac users, so could not download Epson drivers or utilities. i just bought it two months ago. It failed quickly, with color printing having lines across the image. Nozzles failed after only six or seven times using (under two months). Seller will not accept return, sadly after two months. Way overpriced for what it delivers. Try HP and also avoid seller who advertised this as new machine.
customer_reviews.author: B. Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Now a phantom paper jam has made it useless. There is no paper jammed in any of ...
customer_reviews.text: worked for 2 years 11 months. Now a phantom paper jam has made it useless. There is no paper jammed in any of the places that can be checked, and the printer still will not work, and says there is a paper jam. -- ?? I expect it is a dirty or bad sensor. ? !!! I wonder if there is somewhere to blow air to clean off the sensors? In the mean time we have no printer..... WE have made a few trips to Kinkos already. Is it reallt necessary to replace a printer in lees than 3 years of very light use?
customer_reviews.author: Dan Gottesman

customer_reviews.title: Black pages soaking in ink
customer_reviews.text: Printer worked well for a while then it started printing the whole page black. I mean black ink soaking the paper wet. Made sure software was up to date, and bought a new black ink cartridge. Restarted multiple times. Unplugged power overnight, cleaned the print heads multiple times, and still all black pages. When I called tech service the guy pretended not to hear after waiting 30 minutes. Horrible printer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric G

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 5 years ... guess that’s typical these days
customer_reviews.text: Had purchased two originally. Never had great print quality, cartridges were always replaced with Epson brand and they needed to be changed significantly more than previous printer (Cannon - lasted over 10 years). Both printers started having issues detecting brand new cartridges, clogged heads, and couldn’t scan documents from the feeder (had worked originally). Long story short, I’d pass on this printer. Oh and the touch screen is really clunky.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Lane

customer_reviews.title: Good, but, make sure you plenty on ink
customer_reviews.text: Very good, only huge frustration is that when it throws up a "you're out of ink" warning, there is ABSOLUTELY no chance of printing an additional page, even just one or two. I wish it would give you even a 20 page warning to you could have time to order additional ink----but no, right in the middle of the project it tells you "you're out". I know there is a way to open a supported program that will tell you the ink amount left, but, that is not on my daily to do lisk.
customer_reviews.author: Jon S. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Have to clean printheads EVERY time!
customer_reviews.text: Ink doesn’t last! Dries up WAY fast!! I have to clean printheads every single time I use this dang thing!!! Which means, it goes thru ink like crazy!!! WiFi works beautifully, I’ve mever had any issues with finding the printer, it just doesn’t print. Now I’m getting an error message every 2-3 times & have to turn it off completely & restart to get it to work. VERY frustrating!! I’m sticking with HP, they’re way more reliable!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I loved it but hate it now
customer_reviews.text: This printer will NOT let you do anything if the black cartridge is out of ink or not responding !!! I use this printer mainly for faxing and scanning. My Black cartridge was running unused and now not recognised. Now printer will not let you do anything !! When I turn on the printer it will stop at the point where Epson forces you to buy their cartridge even if you don't need them to use its non printer/copy functionality !! now it is total waste of money
customer_reviews.author: INFOGLAZEdotCOM

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: This printer eats through ink. I bought this printer for my college classes (my old printer had margin issues) with its good reviews and all but was disappointed. I printed three pages double sided. The black ink was gone. One of the other reasons I bought this was because it was advertised as less ink - more pages printed ect. The ink also cost more than any other printer Ive owned before. I bought the Epson brand ink set and the printer will not recognize its own brand ink. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Canon that was fine but only printed one sided. So the feature I wanted most is the two-side printing. This works but it's a process to get there. 2nd issue is that it sometimes does not recognize our wireless and we need to turn off wireless and turn it back on just to print something from online. 3rd issue - as far as printing photos...forget it. I cannot get the printer software to not print in color - only shades of magenta! I read that it's an issue because of printer software not communicating w/ computer software in printing - but clearly, my MAC and Epson WF-3540 are not friends. Impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Very frustrating: 1. Attempts to use the scanner almost always result in the message "scanner not found." Sometimes the message can be resolved by turning the device off and back on or unplugging the USB cable and then plugging back in again, but it occasionally requires a reboot. This, even though the printer never generates such an error. 2. Paper doesn't really feed straight no matter what I try. It's not noticeable when printing a text document on 8 1/2 x 11 paper, but it is with photos, especially when printing borderless because you get a thin crooked white space along some edge.
customer_reviews.author: smoddelm

customer_reviews.title: Baffling bad software/drivers/connection with computer.
customer_reviews.text: The Epson software is bafflingly bad. It looks like it was written by a Windows developer in the 90's. It's not intuitive and painful to use. It doesn't communicate well with the printer (e.g. if you press scan to PC from the printer window, it send a jpg to your photos folder without opening the scanning software or even letting you know where the file destination is). The printer has problems communicating with Apple OS. This can require unplugging the USB, restarting the printer and/or computer. Epson support isn't helpful either.
customer_reviews.author: Soulsurfer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and Great Value
customer_reviews.text: We switched to Epson after several years of HP printers, and we are very pleased with our new Workforce 3540! All the functions were very easy to set-up and the software stays updated through the Apple App store. The printer is relatively quiet, holds a large volume of paper in the main tray, has a second tray for legal paper and the rear feed is a nice added feature for envelopes. The quality of the output is excellent. Ink prices appear to be slightly less than HP, but we've not had enough time to determine if they are comparable in page output. All in all this is a great little printer for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Barnmaster

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for home and business.
customer_reviews.text: I had this printer for six months and it started showing lines when printing in color. I use Epson ink and cleaned the heads and everything else. I bought it new through Amazon but Epson said they would not honor the warranty because they didn't sell it directly to Amazon, but to another party. What type of service is this? I contacted Amazon and even though it was past the time of returns they agreed to take it back and refund my money. Never another Epson product for me.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Good all-in-one, a bit misleading on the print sources
customer_reviews.text: Using it wifi only and needed it for the family for the iOS device printing. My old photosmart was far too long in the tooth. This has 2 paper trays. The flexible upper one that holds all sorts of media and the lower one that only holds 8x10 type paper. I thought great, put the envelopes in the top and the paper in the bottom and I never have to load/change again. WRONG. There's no way to pick a tray from iOS and no way to configure the printer for the default, so iOS prints to tray 1 which means I need regular paper in it. Epson numbered the trays wrong. But otherwise the printer does exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Easy Breezy Epson!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived from Amazon well packed and in perfect condition. Unpacked it last night and set up printer parameters, then installed it on my MacBook Pro - easy, breezy install. Clear well written instructions and everything went smoothy. This is a solid, attractive printer for the $$. I appreciate the front loading paper tray and there are two of them. I'll try to remember to add more to this reveiw as I use the printer but so far I am relieved by how smoothly and easily everything went!
customer_reviews.author: Marina M.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this printer for home use for a household with two middle schoolers who frequently print school reports, web pages, etc. Set-up was fairly easy for multiple laptops and iPads and the web printing/scanning features are very handy. Haven't tried any serious photo printing yet, but this printer is speedy and the quality for text and web page images is good. For the price, I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Bopien

customer_reviews.title: Great for SOHO
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. Fast. Beautiful prints. Too many options. Faxing works well. Scanning works well. Capacity is good (two trays plus rear feeder). ADF for copying, scanning and faxing makes life easier. Easy to connect via network from Mac OSX (Snow leopard and Maverick), Windows 7, iOS and Android (via Cloud Print). Has Epson's own cloud printing solution, but also connects to Google's. A bit thirsty in terms on ink, but I found a "generic" replacement cartridges on Amazon and they work great, and cost a fraction of the price. I like is so much I bought it's little brother (2640) for a "limited space" application.
customer_reviews.author: Yanomami

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for only a few months but have printed over 300 double-sided color invitations and matching envelopes plus a whole host of one-sided and two-sided documents. The printer ramps up very quickly and the print speed is perfect. I cannot speak to the wireless settings because I don't use them much but my laptop can print without a problem. The colors are crisp and the black is the darkest I have ever seen. The scanner is fast and the auto-sheet feed is very dependable. I cannot say enough good things about this printer.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Great for basic home use.
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the photo capability on draft...very illegible when printing PDFs. However, it is fast, it is reliable, it duplex prints without a hitch. Now if I can figure out how to make this machine staple papers together....just kidding. If you want a printer that won't ask you to buy a 3-to-5 color cartridge because the only the blue color ran out...get this printer. If you want a printer that is fast and the text is crystal clear...get this printer. FYI...if you have trouble scanning on this printer via WIFI, then I suggest you manually enter the scanner's ip address into the epson scan settings. It took me two days to figure this out. Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: William Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Good when it works, but...
customer_reviews.text: Just doesn't last. I bought one of these because of the speed and features. It worked great while it lasted. Just wouldn't print certain colors or printed blurry after about 5 months. Tried different inks, cleaning the heads, etc., but nothing worked. Like it so much thought maybe just a fluke I bought another one. Same thing happened after 11 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey R.

customer_reviews.title: Solid but bulky machine
customer_reviews.text: I am replacing my old and bit strange Hewlett Packard printer with this one and, so far, so good. It appears to work reliably using Wi-Fi and it prints from three of my 6 computers. It likes its large Cassette No 1 more than Cassette No 2 and, so far, I had only one paper jam. It remains to be seen how long the mandatory 4 cartridges will last and whether a half price replacement I ordered is going to be adequate. On both accounts the HP printer was not satisfactory but it still works. If you have a space for 30 lbs piece of equipment, I can recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: oldcaman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I was on a fence choosing between laser and inkjet multifunction printers. When I saw laser printer cartridges prices, it helped me to make up my mind. The quality of the printer in that price range just blew my mind. Starting with the packaging and ending with the cartridge carrier - it all says "QUALITY". It prints fast, crispy text. With relatively low noise. I connected it to my network via Ethernet cable and configured my clients to print via network. Setting up was a breeze, but I am somewhat technically inclined. Epson released a few firmware upgrades, and upgrade process went smoothly. Awesome printer!
customer_reviews.author: Skeptic

customer_reviews.title: Poor print quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer in 2013 so I understand that it is 6 years old. However, it is a horrible printer and consistently has issues with print quality. It seems to use a lot of ink and I've had to refill the ink cartridges frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Mj MD

customer_reviews.title: it locks out the printer making it absolutely useless. It always had paper jams
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but problems with this printer. It lasted less than two years. I installed a continuous ink system into it, which was a huge problem in itself. It will not recognize the yellow ink cartridge any more. When this happens, it locks out the printer making it absolutely useless. It always had paper jams, over inking, did not like to pull labels from the rear tray. I still have it, but its basically a parts machine for someone. If you want a printer to last, there is only 3 brands to buy, the rest are absolute junk. Canon, HP, or Lexmark, nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: P. Christopher Heffernan

customer_reviews.title: Epson will make you buy things you don't need.
customer_reviews.text: I have almost full all cartridge and for some strange reason it is showing Cyan is out. Now i need a print my UPS label which i can't do that as it is not letting to print black and white with almost full Black cartridge. i dont know why in 2020 you will need color cartridge to print black only. I remember i had a printer before which can print with with any cartridge and once all the print came yellow and that is how i knew my others colors are out. for me it feels like a good business strategy of Epson to exploit customer. What an evil corporation!!!
customer_reviews.author: mrc

customer_reviews.title: 2013 and it is now pretty much unusable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer in December, 2013 and it is now pretty much unusable. It constantly says it has a paper jam although there is no paper jammed. It also just stops printing for no apparent reason after a page or two. It's out of warranty and at these prices hardly worth spending $100 or more for someone to repair it.
customer_reviews.author: Sagebrush

customer_reviews.title: Decent copier; LOUSY scanner
customer_reviews.text: I had a previous Epson all-in-one that died, and from experience I know that I'm better off buying a new one than trying to have an old one repaired. The old one, an Epson Workforce 645 worked perfectly well in all functions. This Workforce copies just fine, but the scanner positively sucks. I'm constantly having it just stop in the middle of a document or sending a message saying that there was a communications error with the computer. I do a lot of scanning of old files in my efforts to go paperless, and I am just frustrated to death over this thing.
customer_reviews.author: GW Alumna

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product For the Price
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the WorkForce WF-3540 is a decent all-in-one. The one complaint I have about the product is that it experiences paper jams at times when doing duplex printing... My old high end commercial grade HP rarely had this issue, so perhaps I am spoiled. Well, at least it is less of a pain to clear the paper jams in the Epson when they do occur (which isn't all the time but still more than it should be...). Anyway, I can't complain too much. You still get more than what you pay for with this model, so unless you have the need for extremely high volume duplex printer, this model is probably your best compromise on functionality and price.
customer_reviews.author: T. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Would Have Been Great...
customer_reviews.text: ...if it lasted. I'm glad I waited to write the review. This printer has very good features for the money. PROS: duplex printing; print speed; ADF works great for 50+ pages scanning; having aux paper tray lets me use one tray for mailing labels; airprint is wonderful. CONS: Scanner produces slightly crooked scans; ink is ridiculously expensive; and this problem: I've had the printer about 15 months. (That's right, three months out of warranty now.) I haven't even printed 1,000 pages - probably fewer than 700. A plastic gear in the duplexer unit snapped off, and would cost $40 to replace. I say "would" because I'm not willing to put $40 into this piece of crap. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: LisaC

customer_reviews.title: Works well, pretty easy to setup, prints fine, but scanning needs help
customer_reviews.text: Setup was pretty easy. You have to read the instructions carefully, but I got it right the first time and it works well. Wireless printing is great. For typical home usage, this printer is perfect. However, the scanning software that comes with this printer is horrible. I ended up having to use Microsoft's scanning software because the packaged software was so bad. If they had a better scanning system I would definitely have rated this product higher. Printing is perfectly fine but scanning is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Forces you to buy their poorly reviewed expensive ink. Will not print with perfectly good aftermarket ink. No more EPSON for me.
customer_reviews.text: Epson has *aggressively* forced me to throw away tons of perfectly good non-epson ink with their insane "genuine" ink checks. And their ink is poorly reviewed and expensive to boot. I will not be purchasing another Epson. I literally cannot print even though I have ink. This is ridiculous and unethical.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: All in one
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in 2014. Still using it today. Scans, copies, prints... I love the all in one feature. However, there is a thin black line that shows up on all scans in the same location. It's not annoying enough for me to do anything about it. Just worth mentioning.
customer_reviews.author: Spring Kim

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality and installs easily
customer_reviews.text: Have always had HP printers for the least 15+ years up until recently. After reading the reviews on this product, I purchased it for my business and have been very pleased with it. In fact, I recommended it to a friend as well and they, too, are delighted with their purchase. I use it with my MacBook Pro and iPhone, as I can print from my iPhone - or any AirPrint device - easily and readily. Highly recommend as it sets up easily. Mine is setup totally on my wireless network, although it can be setup via USB as well.
customer_reviews.author: Poiema

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: I just moved and was looking for an printer/fax/copier. I especially liked that this one is wireless. My network has security turned on so it took a couple of tries to get it on my network. I was typing the encrypted password version when it can only handle the password in plain text. That's ok, it is still secure. One other thing, the drivers that come with the printer are outdated and did not install correctly on my Windows 7 laptop. I downloaded latest software from the website and was up and running in no time. I would purchase this again. the printer and copier work fine, I have not tested the fax part.
customer_reviews.author: Josie R.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult Mac User Install
customer_reviews.text: The usual and customary .dmg file loaded normally from the supplied CD & internet updates to the drivers installed normally. However, the device failed to show up in the printers available to this Mountain Lion iMac and subsequently have had to search back through Epson.com & Apple.com for updated drivers. This is 'not' for the inexperienced user nor is it at all what's expected from Epson. I'm sure once all the GB size updates come down from Apple; the device ought to function well and good. However, for the Mac user-- Buyer Beware. This will not be a cake walk to make this connect to your system and work.
customer_reviews.author: PixMaker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, easy wiireless, easy to use, easy, easy, easy!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it December 2012. Received it about a week later. Easy to setup. Directions are simple and easy to follow. Removed packing tape(s), loaded paper tray, installed ink and followed the on screen prompts for setup. The Software CD made the wireless setup easy and painless. Using the on screen menu, I activated the Wireless setup and at the same time pressed the "one button setup" on my Linksys wireless router. And Voila! The printer found the wireless network and we were ready to print. Print speed is fast and graphics look professional. Overall very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TDnTX

customer_reviews.title: New printer
customer_reviews.text: My old Canon quit working, so I looked at replacements. This printer was highly rated by almost everyone, the only objection was the cost of ink. I ordered the remanufactured ink tanks as the cost is about 1/4 of what I paid for canon ink. Setup for my MAC and the wife's laptop pc took about 5 minutes, the only confusion was with the network choice, which actually allows WiFi connections. All functions work very well and print quality with the remanufactured ink is very good. The scanner works from both, but is more transparent from the Mac. The paper trays are great, no more bent paper! I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Setup of Epson WorkForce WF-3540
customer_reviews.text: Excellent multi-function printer, scanner,fax. Setup is apparently easy on both the Mac and PC, but easier on the PC. There are more logical selections on the PC. The primary problem on the Mac is not offering to update software earlier in the Setup process. Mac (10.8.4) did not offer software update until after I had installed everything on my wife's iMac and my MacBook Pro. Setup is much more logical on the PC than the Mac. Bottom line: One can struggle to set up on the Mac. Easier on the PC (Windows 7).
customer_reviews.author: Pop

customer_reviews.title: would buy again
customer_reviews.text: We have had this printer now for almost 2 years - here is our experience. The good: - printing is very good quality and most everything is fairly simple once you figure it out. We print from pc's and iphones and have always used the wireless with few issues. - Has a lot of useful functions for scanning, copying and even printing lined paper and stuff like that The bad: - the ink is expensive - you will spend more on ink than you spent on the printer after just a few replacements. - you cannot print in b&w without replacing the color cartridges I would buy this unit again as I have just not seen anything better.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: So glad my old printer died.
customer_reviews.text: I was in the process of obtaining a mortgage when my 5 or 6 year old Epson kicked the bucket. I really need a printer fast. After reading some reviews, I picked this model. It was on my doorstep within 24 hours after buying it on Amazon. I have needed to print, sign, scan and send more documents than ever. This printer does so much more. I can load all my documents and have them scan into a single file, quickly. Printing on two sides of the paper is nice too, when you are printing 35 pages from your assessors report. It is much easier to load paper than my old printer. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tiaramonkeybird

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for awhile
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for awhile, though it felt like it went through more ink than expected for my very infrequent use. After the black ink ran out I apparently left it empty for too long, because after replacing the cartridge it barely prints. I suspect that ink has dried somewhere or there's an air gap. After running the "clean heads" and other such tools it's not much better. Still fighting with it, but annoyed enough to post a review today.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice. The reviews are correct.
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. My goal was to find an all in one which would be able to send a multiple page fax, sheet fed, so I don't have to do it page by page. This one did not disappoint. What's even better, it prints really fast. The wireless hooked right up to my MacBook Pro and has stayed hooked up. Sometimes the MacBook would suddenly stop recognizing other printers. Solid construction, holds a ton of paper, and takes no more space than other printers. I couldn't be happier. My grown children HAD to buy one because they were so impressed. Best part? It doesn't sound like its having a personal earthquake when it prints.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Messina

customer_reviews.title: best multi use machine I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: The epson multi copy fax print scan does it all..and does it well.. the best multi use machine I've ever owned.. uses ink sparingly yet it gives clear copies, photo prints, all functions work and work great.. after years of owning scrap Lexmark s with lousy operatiion systems and bogus software, this epson workforce does exactly what it's supposed to do.. even updates go smoothly. .and it keeps working away without skipping a beat... almost two years in, and still100% satisfied with all facets of this reasonably priced office tool.
customer_reviews.author: joe m

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Epson really did a great job on this printer. two cartridges to allow for storage of photo paper (cart 1 only) and letter paper (either cart) or whatever. plus, the unit is able to be customized to select either paper cartridge as the default for each and every setting (fax, print, copy). the draft mode really is a draft, and at times not very easy to read. Standard mode is totally fine and the ink seems to last a long time. I suggest the 127 ink cartridges vs. the standard 126 Ink carts that come shipped with the printer because they over double the output capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Iflyme

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with the right router
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews here and decided this is the best Airprint option for my ipad. However, initially, more often than not my ipad could not find it, the Epson iPrint app could not find it, neither could the Printer Pro app. It turns out my Belkin router was the problem (but the Belkin works flawlessly for wireless for the ipads and the iphones). I changed to an Asus router RT-N12B1, and haven't had trouble connecting the printer. I use the cheaper substitute ink () and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: TheSaxMan

customer_reviews.title: This is the best printer
customer_reviews.text: II am coming up on an year of using this beauty and still running on the original ink tanks. This would be my 5th MFP and i think i have found that's a keeper. Print quality is great. Faxing is the best, now i don't go looking for fax machines, i have one at home and works without a dedicated fax line. I have used the other features as well and none of it disappoints. If anyone is looking for an affordable MFP, this is it Look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Shravan Sundaram

customer_reviews.title: Super printer
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this printer is hard to beat. It has all the print and copy features I need, as well as scanning and fax capabilities. It prints fast, is relatively quiet and the printing is very good quality. I love the fact that it is wireless and not tied to one computer (although you can use ethernet or USB connections if you need to..) The controls are very nice and fairly intuitive. The only negative about this printer is the high cost of ink cartridges. I choose to use Epson original inks but you could save quite a bit of money with recycled cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer, Easy to Setup and Use!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I ordered this printer for our home office as well as for personal use. It was extremely easy to setup on our wifi network and setup our computers to link to the printer. It prints out copies really fast. It also is very easy to scan and you can upload the scanned copies to have them sent directly to your email or a cloud. It also prints copies easily. The printer itself can be pretty bulky and large. We had to put it on a separate three drawer unit to avoid taking up space on our desk. Overall, we're really happy with the printer. It's a good printer at a good price!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for 10 months but then...
customer_reviews.text: The Epson WF-3540 was a great machine until it was 10 months old to the day. Lasted from January 15, 2013 until October 15,2013. Now it is dead! Not repairable, and certainly not returnable as far as I know. I will try to put up a stink with Amazon where I ordered it but I pretty much know how that will turn out. Do not buy this machine, do not pay attention to the reviews that say they are great after a week or even several months. There is a software glitch and when it is done it's done!
customer_reviews.author: Just my opinion.

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer
customer_reviews.text: Spent a lot of time looking for a printer that could duplex print. Was going to get a Laser printer and decided that the price and features of this printer would serve our needs. Very easy to set up, and use. Print quality great for documents and web pages. Have not tried to print photos yet. Love the 2 drawers for paper. I use both drawers for regular paper as that is what we use to print on 99% of the time. Great value for the money. Duplex prints without any paper jams yet after about 2 months of light to moderate usage. Like the "AirPrint" from my iPhone. I would recommend this printer quite highly.
customer_reviews.author: BDPitthome

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup and Relatively fast for an Inkjet
customer_reviews.text: I'm no computer expert, so was expecting a difficult time getting this to work on our wireless network. I'm over 65, female, and retired from teaching--basically, over the hill. All I knew were the network's name and the password. Come to find out, that's all I needed to know. The printer practically set itself up. I run all Mac (which is new to me so I was expecting that to be an issue too) and had no problem at all. What a kick to print from the iPhones and iPads. Yea!
customer_reviews.author: Joy Blonska

customer_reviews.title: Running on Wifi on Windows 7 and 8 in ten minutes
customer_reviews.text: We decided to replace our printer because we could never get the wifi connection to work properly in Windows 8. We needed on with two trays (one for labels and one for paper), as well as a copier and scanner. This is one of the few units that offered all that. Fortunately, getting it to work with Windows 7 and 8 was a snap. The process was the same for both computers. You install the software from the disk and type in your wifi password and router information (sometimes on the bottom of your router). That was it. The printer has worked fine every since. For the price and ease of installation, this has been a great printer.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Bradley

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: I have two children in high school one child in middle school. We need a printer that could handle printing all of their assignments as well as anything else our family needs. I have been impressed with the quality printing and copying. My favorite part is the wireless printing. I have a laptop and I love printing from anywhere in the house. I was afraid I wouldn't be able to set up the printer for wireless printing because I am not an expert at technology. It was easier than I thought it would be. I also like printing from my iPad. If you download the Epson Print app, you can also print from your other devices.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bess

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good wireless printer that had a little more functionality that the "low budget" ones. Imagine my surprise when I found this one for less than $150 with everything I needed plus extras. Set up was very easy. The print quality is great and all the scanner/ copy functions are excellent. Was able to synch it with all the devices I needed to (Windows and Apple). Name brand cartridges can be expensive but I get the refurbished non-Epson ones and it's been perfect. You can EMAIL this printer documents and it prints at home. I can't be more pleased - definitely recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.author: TheThreeBs

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Set up was easy (with the manual) and only took about an hour from start to print. I have been enjoying wireless printing since I ordered about 2 month ago. I set up cloud print from my phone and also set up our 2 laptops to wirelessly print with ease. Great quality prints - both documents and photos turn out great. I have had to do some experimenting with how to print onto 4x6 glossy photo papers and have found that cassette 1 is the best choice - not the back intake. I cannot comment on the fax capabilities as I have not set my printer up to fax.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Epson WorkForce WF-3540 Printer
customer_reviews.text: The Epson WorkForce WF-3540 Wireless Printer was by far the easiest wireless printer I have ever setup. The printer may be set up manually using the control panel or automatically using the U.S.B. cable. I used the automatic system using the U.S.B. communication link. This printer was operational in wireless mode six minutes after I opened the box. The colors are crisp and clear, the print speed is good, and the resolution is excellent for the cost of the unit. This unit is used in an office for printing about one thousand pages a month. We have since bought another unit, also for office work.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Stearns

customer_reviews.title: Great for approximately 8 months.
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this printer for about 8 months. After that it started printing "funny." Sometimes the lines are blurry, sometimes lines are just "off" as in they are shifted up or down in certain segments. Lately though, If I have it print double sided, or print maybe 4+ pages it jams. Every. Time. I've trouble shot it, had it self clean, realigned the heads etc. It might fix it for a single printing, generally it doesn't. I'm at the point of "good enough." So yes, great printer for about 6-8 months then it kind of just feels like a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Applegate

customer_reviews.title: Works seemlessly with my Mac/Apple products
customer_reviews.text: I have just been tired of trying to mess with my old printer...the scanner bed wasn't recognized, the fax crapped out after a few months...and I could never print from my iPhone or iPad as advertised. UNTIL NOW! This printer was working wirelessly (don't waste money on the USB cord, it's not needed if you have a wifi already set up). It has already copied, scanned, faxed, and printed from my MacBook, iPhone and iPad within minutes after setup. Actually the first thing I did was scan and fax and it was awesome. I am so happy I found this printer. My dad has the 3520 and I think it's discontinued but he loves his as well.
customer_reviews.author: Regina C

customer_reviews.title: Uses ink too fast
customer_reviews.text: Hoped for a printer that was really user friendly. This one is made for the high-tech user and I need son's help to get new ink set; plus the ink is too expensive and there's no way to print out an article with color photos in just black or grey ink. Once one color is too low you have to replace entire cartridge. Not made for a retired lady like me on a low budget. To be fair, it does a good job printing, but will be costly. Now I am extremely choosy about what I'll print in order to make the ink last. Not exactly what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie E.

customer_reviews.title: Scans, prints, copies, all of its features are available over wireless link.
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble with scanning wirelessly when I installed the drivers directly from the disc. Once I ran through the software updater, removed the printer/scanner device as shown in the Win7 device manager, I was able to re-detect it simply, and rerun the scanner configuration tool and, by manually entering the IP address, find the scanner. I think it works great, but it's not a color laser - this I understood. High cost of toner (though probably cheaper in the long run) is what I wanted to avoid; I don't use it very much, but works well for my two-person network. I think it was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Herr_Blucher

customer_reviews.title: So-so print quality
customer_reviews.text: This is an updated review. Originally I said: "We have had this printer a few months now and it has been very reliable. We have not used it for photos yet, but it prints text and Web pages fast and clearly. The set up was quite easy." I have reduced the rating to three stars because over time, despite repeated cleanings, the printing quality is awful if you use the regular settings. Using the "high" quality setting gives us mediocre results. Everything else functions well. When we have a serious document to be printed, we use the old Canon Pixma -- slow but very high quality printing.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Shoppin

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Features
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for awhile now and it has done it's job well. The print quality, in my opinion, is better than laser. The only glitch I ran into was it insisting I had a paper jam one time when there wasn't one. The solution was simple (I believe unplugging it for a minute, but can't remember exactly) and there haven't been any other issues before or after. I love being able to scan more than one page at a time and all the other features this thing has (some of which I haven't even explored yet.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I thought
customer_reviews.text: The printer has always been just OK. I expected it to be better than the HP printer I replaced with it, but other than being wireless, it was no better and in fact probably not as good. In addition, around September of this year lines started showing up in things that I printed, especially pictures...and I am unable to resolve this issue. **This is a later post - I am going to trash this printer, would NEVER consider another Epson - slow, unreliable, after just ordering new ink for it, now it won't recognize the cartridges - MAJOR disappointment.... going back to HP
customer_reviews.author: C. W. Long

customer_reviews.title: Awseome
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace my Canon that died. Only used the inkjet for photos, using my color laser for everything else. However, this All in One is so good, I use it for everything now. It has a really low standby power consumption (less than 2W compared to over 20W for my laser), comes to life instantly (no warm up) and is not constantly making noises like my Canon (seemed forever to be cleaning or calibrating or ??). Scanning and copying are excellent and the replacement cartridges are so inexpensive, it's cheaper to run than my laser.
customer_reviews.author: CoastalFolks

customer_reviews.title: poor performance
customer_reviews.text: Within 60 days this unit failed with a message that said "paper jam" There was no jam and I called Epson for help. They could not fix it and had me return it after a replacement unit arrived. This new unit also failed on installation with two error messages. When it said "maintenance unit failure" they said they will send a replacement for this component. It was to come via overnight delivery. I have been without a printer for over two weeks as a result of these failures. The Epson support unit worked with me for 45 minutes to solve the problem. The printer now works beautifully as I expected it would. It is a great unit.
customer_reviews.author: sigxray

customer_reviews.title: The print quality is horrible for photos and the ink is very expensive
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for over a year. The print quality is horrible for photos and the ink is very expensive. I don't know if there are some compatibility problems with iMacs but I always have problems with page layouts when I print, very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Edward M. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Beat out the color lasers
customer_reviews.text: I was considering a color laser to replace one that dissappointed us. So far, so good. Set up was painless, went wireless so it was not tied to one server. Have not tried the duplex thing yet, but that was one reason we went with this model. We had to have the scanner, and the document feeder sure beats lifting the lid all the time. Though we are not in any hurry, this thing is really fast at everthing it does, it flys rings around anything else we've used. And yes it does wake itself up to print from standby mode.
customer_reviews.author: Stoney T

customer_reviews.title: A Terrific Printer
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn't give this printer a 5 is: the print quality, which although satisfactory, is not above standard/mediocre. I am used to the excellent quality of another brand of printer. This said, it is very easy to set-up, has great connectivity to their Epson Connect cloud and is real workhorse, printing many pages quietly and quickly. Also, the cartridges are very easy to load--unlike others. It prints fast without annoying paper jams. Overall, this is a good, solid printer if you are not too picky about print quality.
customer_reviews.author: Barbfl

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 15 monhts --using it 1-2x a week to print 1 - 10 pages each time!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this all in one printer in May 2013. Did not use it much, but when I did use it I really like it. The wireless capability was terrific. Then suddenly it gave an error message "Pape jam." I checked every place there could be a jam and there was no paper! I called support. They told me it was a hardware failure and, since I am a few months out of warranty, they could give me discount on a new one. Really -- it's 17 months old, hardly used at all -- and I need to buy a new one!! No thanks-- No more Epsons for me!
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Epson WF-3540 Wireless All in One
customer_reviews.text: Great printer, but I saw a warning on internet that Epson is making it very hard to use generic or re-manufactured ink cartridges, the site warned not to update because Epson may install software (as it has in other countries) to make you have to us their cartridges. It set up easily, but I had a problem with wireless in that it would not print or print very slow. I solved the problem by making my modem send out stronger signal by taking a paper plate, covering it with tinfoil and putting it on the antenna by cutting two slots and sliding it over the antenna. Printer output is clear and of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: rlm

customer_reviews.title: Great Features. Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for about 8 months now and I'm very impressed with this printer. I like it so much I bought my in laws one for christmas so they could easily print from their iPad. Here are some great features that I use a lot: AirPrint Borderless printing Double sided printed Collating Scan to email account Print lined paper This printer is FAST and super easy to use. The ink cartridges are expensive but aren't they all really.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Bansley

customer_reviews.title: easy set up for Mac.
customer_reviews.text: easily identified my router, and set up was easy. the only criticism is that you need a USB connection directly from the printer to the Mac if you want to scan documents to the computer. Not an issue for me since they sit next to each other, but... a possible issue for Mac users. I have printed wirelessly from a sony laptop, my iphone and ipad without difficulty. scanned multiple documents with document feeder- much better than doing each page individually. overall seems like a decent printer at a good price. too soon to tell about the ink, i've had it less than two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: cutter23

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a printer for Apple and PC products. Did some research and settled on the Epson. I considered price and ratings from several areas including Amazon and Cnet. I've only had the printer for about two months but so far all my expectations have been met. The printer is a bit loud but I've never really heard a quiet one. Prints fast. Does double sided prints and black only. Installation was a snap with the easy to read diagrams and the disk guide. Apple products found it immediately. PC's took a bit longer but not really a hassle. Great so far! If things change I'll update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Unc A

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, fantastic printing
customer_reviews.text: I hate buying new peripherals as a rule because it means spending the better part of a day setting them up. This one was ready in minutes--the touchscreen talks you through setup, and takes over the whole process while you just watch...and marvel. The setup CD handles networking and registration, and once our "mothership PC" had everything installed the whole house was using the printer in minutes, too. If you dread dealing with computer gadgets...this is your printer. Oh--and the printouts are beautiful and it's versatile, too! All that...and look at the price! You can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Dagnal-Myron

customer_reviews.title: False Error Message - "Jam paper"
customer_reviews.text: This Printer is giving me "false Paper Jam error message," there is NO paper jammed in the machine, I was forced to open the entire machine, turned it upside down just to double, and triple check to make sure there is NO paper or any object stuck or jammed anywhere in the machine... And even though there isn't anything, the error message saying "Jam Paper" won't go away rendering the entire printer useless. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Abb Ke

customer_reviews.title: Problem Printer
customer_reviews.text: I am having problems with this printer/fax/scanner. I use it very little for faxing and scanning, but I do use it as a copier and a printer from my laptop. The copier works fine, and does the printer -- when it is working. However it seems to be giving me trouble lately by not working at all. Everything seems to be connected correctly, but it just doesn't print. I fiddled around with it yesterday and it worked, but today it is not operating again. I use the help menu, but it doesn't help. I may need to get on the phone with their help line to see what's wrong with this Epson.
customer_reviews.author: Judith T. Kliks

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Printer
customer_reviews.text: I rarely give 5 stars to any product but this is a fantastic printer. I have had over a dozen printers over the years and this is the best. The features I like the best are: 1) automatic double sided printing 2) Speed in all modes/colors 3) 2 paper bins - I use 1 bin for normal printing and the other for photo printing 4) UI is much better than other - leaves no room for guessing. Needless to say - I would recommend this printer to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Jim Kavanaugh

customer_reviews.title: printing yes, scanning no
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer after reading a number of reviews on both Amazon and tech sites. Fast printing, hwoever it seems to go through ink rather quickly. And I could NEVER get the scanning software installed. I spent a fair amount of time researching the problem and it's a common one. Epson support was no help. I ended up buying third party software to get a scan from computer function.
customer_reviews.author: S. Orr

customer_reviews.title: This shipped from Amazon over a year out of warranty and DOA
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after reading all the reviews that were so positive. Received it today, it was not working out of the box so I called Epson for support and learned that its warranty expired over a year ago! Have spent almost 2 hours - and am still on the phone with as I write this - Epson trying to get it RMA'd since it was out of warranty. Why Amazon would send us products that are out of warranty is baffling! Buyer beware with this printer. Seems they're several years old, out of warranty and what is being shipped will take hours to get RMA'd if it's DOA like mine was!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin A

customer_reviews.title: Needs to provide a little feedback
customer_reviews.text: This printer scares me! That's how fast it is, most of the time. Lovely printing, easy to set up, etc. It has one flaw that we have seen or else it would deserve five stars: when it is asleep, and you send something to print, it just sits there...and so you may think something is wrong and need to do something. But then it wakes up eventually. Then it is fast! Epson needs to have it state to the new owner "Hi, working on your work. Be patient. No need to do anything."
customer_reviews.author: Ben Hurt

customer_reviews.title: Just the ticket for a small but busy office
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an HP 8600 that had problem after problem with this Epson WF 3540. All the same functions plus two paper trays and, I find, more reliable wireless connection. ADF paper feed seems better designed, less likely to result in crooked, unprofessional looking scanned copies. Works fine with Windows 8. Unfortunately, upgrade to Windows 8.1 disables the scanning function from the computer. Can still scan documents to a flash drive, however, and download to computer. I assume the software fix for this is on the way.... A very good, reasonably-priced machine for a small, busy office.
customer_reviews.author: ReadingGaol

customer_reviews.title: A paper jammer of a kind
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this printer for 1 month and it has jammed as many times as my previously owned printer that I had for 3 years! Even worse sometimes, even after I remove the jammed paper, it still indicates a jam which prevents me from printing.. Don't bother buying.
customer_reviews.author: Reem, Brooklyn, NY

customer_reviews.title: Issues receving faxes, the device is not releasing the phone line.
customer_reviews.text: Since I purchased this printer I have had a consistent problem receiving faxes; after a couple of faxes the device refuses to drop the phone line so it rings busy. I have narrowed the problem down to the fax (everything was working with my old HP printer). I e-mailed Epson tech support and I received NO response, but I did get a survey asking how I liked their "help". I am extremely disappointed with this product's ability to reliably receive a fax. If you do not need the fax component, then this is a excellent printer.
customer_reviews.author: Pinky

customer_reviews.title: Good printer BUT NOT FOR WIFI
customer_reviews.text: Generally, the printer did very well for USB connected activity. But not for WiFi. I have wasted far too many hours of my life trying to get this thing to work. Comon Epson.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Works fine (my wife says)
customer_reviews.text: Frankly I am not a big fan of All-In-Ones owing to their failing of one part or another and being left with a printer and fax, a fax and copier, a copier and printer, or just a printer. Wife like s them due to the economy of space in her study. As with most printers like this though, ink capacity is just not meant for high volume printing and the ink is expensive. But what the wife wants ... the wife gets. Not my cup of tea; but, it meets her expectations and that is what counts (until one function of it breaks down).
customer_reviews.author: GRK_Astronomer

customer_reviews.title: one terrible printer
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a moments peace with this printer. I think the built in Epson monitor is causing the trouble. The software that prevents a user from using another manufacturers ink cartridges stops the printing, causes illegible print or no print at all. It is always a problem with the quality of the printing when I can get it to print. I am thinking of junking the printer.
customer_reviews.author: wilken

customer_reviews.title: Epson rules again!  Best Printer out there!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this all-in-one printer if feature packed. Prints great photos too. I also own the epson wide format r3000 printer. 4x6s are almost equivalent. Printer is very user friendly. Color touch lcd screen is a great add-on and really makes the printer easy to use without a computer. Duplexing is great and saves on paper. A printer like this 5 or 10 years ago would have easily cost $300 to $500. Great on ink. Make sure you buy the extra high capacity cartridges. Price is very reasonable. Can't say enough good things about it. Goodbye HP, this is the best printer out for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Alphonso

customer_reviews.title: Epson better than HP
customer_reviews.text: This all in one is an excellent performer for the money. The speed is very good and the two units i have bought both work very well with no issues. I buy the large black ink cartridges and they are a good value compared to HP the standard in overpriced ink. No complaints for any reason. I should have stayed with epson which i used as my first dot matrix printer many years ago. HP has been nothing but an overpriced hassle for me.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Schifter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer but don't expect much out of first ink cartridges
customer_reviews.text: It configures effortlessly. Works on wired, wireless. I love that I can AirPrint from iPad, iPhones... Fast. Great quality. Copy, scan..... Way better than all those junk HPs I've been going through. Note that because of the small ink cartridges that come with it and because of initial priming, don't expect many pages before you need to replace ink. And go for the high capacity cartridges. You will be happy with this truly great printer.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Epson WorkForce WF-3540 Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily for printing my children's school assignments. It doubles for all other home printing that we have to do as a family. I have thoroughly enjoyed this printer. It serves our purpose absolutely, especially with the added benefit of it being wireless. This eliminates the need for siting the printer close to the laptop and/or desktops. We are able to site the printer where we want, and can print from all our iPads, laptops and desktop anywhere in the house. What's more? We can photocopy, scan and fax with the same printer. A great product indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Akin

customer_reviews.title: Great printer with touch screen
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before finally decided to purchase this printer. So far I have been happy with it and have not had any issues. I love the touch screen display!!!! It does print documents pretty fast. Have not tried out the picture printing yet, even though that is an option with this printer as well. I have had to buy more ink for it in the mean time, which was really easy to install even though I had never done it before-walks you right thru the steps on how to change ink, which I thought was pretty convenient. Great printer, and I am happy with my decision to go with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: kleinehex1234

customer_reviews.title: Get Rid of the Proprietary Software
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd time around buying this printer. The first was sent back because the Epson Connect service was unreliable. It now seems stable allowing scans to and from the printer to work as expected. My complaint to Epson is to get rid of the need for Windows/Mac specific software to setup the printer. Not everyone uses Windows or Mac any more and demonstrates Epson is out of touch with the marketplace. Using a web browser that connects directly to the printer for configuring would be far more effective and efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Camera Shy

customer_reviews.title: Alright item if you don't scan alot
customer_reviews.text: My HP printer died after a few years of use so I decided to replace it with this model. While the HP wasn't without it's own issue, I decided to try the Epson brand. Set up was a breeze and it is pretty straight forward in operation. I will comment however, it is fairly noisy and the scan feature is more complicated than it need be. If you are looking for an inexpensive printer and don't mind the noise, it is a fair product for the money. But it is still a cheap printer.....
customer_reviews.author: blakes68

customer_reviews.title: Once you get a good one, it's a keeper
customer_reviews.text: My first one was a dud, would not print a thing. It would go through the motions, but would not put any ink to paper. The second one rushed to me by Amazon (thank you Amazon) was perfect. It prints great in the network, wireless, Google print and Epson's network/email printing. I LOVE this printer. If all it did was print it would be 5 stars, but it also scans. The auto doc feeder leaves a bit to be desired, but the scanning is first rate. Printing is first rate as well. Prints fast and accurate. Would definitely but another if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: PresidentsDad

customer_reviews.title: Wireless printing on both sides from my iPad
customer_reviews.text: Wireless printing on both sides from my iPad.... What's not to love? I have several Epson desktop printers - and I have had many, many going back to the dot matrix days of the 80s. This WF-3540 is fast, quiet, and works as a scanner, a FAX, and a B/W or color printer. It has dual paper trays that are loaded from the front. It worked perfectly out of the box - and it has been used daily for several months now with no problems. My favorite feature is 2-side printing. I give it very high praise.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sjolund

customer_reviews.title: It works great and was so easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This wireless printer is my favorite one so far. The set up went amazingly smooth. It was like it did it itself! I didn't have to fuss over anything. It works seamlessly with my iOS for my iPhone and was instantly recognized. My other new laptop picked it up through the wireless and let up automatically from there too. Anyone wanting to use the printer that is visiting can just set up so quickly too. The print quality is pretty good, I don't use it for photos much, just needed a good priced all in one, but what color printing I have done beats any Canon printer I've had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Bird Girl

customer_reviews.title: Super printer!
customer_reviews.text: Had a Canon multifunction for several years. When it started acting up I dreaded replacing it because of the huge hassel to set it up, but it needed replacing! Workforce arrived and took it out of box, removed tape pluigged it in and presto, my iMac, laptop, iPad and iPhone are all printing with no hassel whatsoever!! When you go to print it starts almost instantly, as opposed to Canon which took forever to start printing. Two trays is super conveient and print quality is great!! No regrets with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Skyking129

customer_reviews.title: Seems Like A Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I have had a run of bad luck with printers lately at homeland at work. Most of these were HP, though one less expensive Epson, quit after 90 days, so I did so e homework this time. This printer appears to be better quality, but we did have to clean the print head several times before we could get the magenta ink to print. Seems like you shouldn't have to do that with a brand new device. The extra paper cassette is nice and so far once we cleaned print quality has been good. We will see if it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

product_meta.title: Epson WorkForce WF-3540 Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Copier, Scanner, 2-Sided Duplex, ADF, Fax. Prints from Tablet/Smartphone. AirPrint Compatible (C11CC31201)
product_meta.description:
Engineered for Business. This hassle-free all-in-one brings you the World’s Fastest print speeds, plus automatic 2-sided print/copy/scan. It features a 3.5-Inch touchscreen, 500-sheet paper capacity, 30-sheet ADF and rear paper feed for added versatility.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


WORKFORCE WF-3540 ALL-IN-ONE PRINTER
PRINT | COPY | SCAN | FAX | ETHERNET | WI-FI

WHAT IS ISO PPM?
Print speed is critically important when buying a printer or all-in-one. But how do you compare print speeds when different manufacturers measure it in different ways? Now you can. Much like “MPG” ratings on new cars, there’s now an industry standard for measuring print speed, which allows for an “apples-to-apples” comparison between different printer models and brands. The International Organization for Standardization (widely known as ISO) developed this industry-approved and internationally accepted standard, specifically for inkjet printers and all-in-ones. It measures “out of the box” (default) print speeds using “real world” printing scenarios, so you can be sure you’re getting a product that performs at the speed you need.
